sanskrit_verse:
एष वै प्रथमः कल्पः प्रदाने हव्यकव्ययोः ।
अनुकल्पस्त्वयं ज्ञेयः सदा सद्भिरनुष्ठितः ॥ ३.१४७॥
transliteration:
eṣa vai prathamaḥ kalpaḥ pradāne havyakavyayoḥ |
anukalpastvayaṃ jñeyaḥ sadā sadbhiranuṣṭhitaḥ || 3.147||
sph_interpretive_translation: This is the first ordinance concerning the offering of Havya and Kavya; this subsequent ordinance must always be followed by those established in Sat.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from alignment with Sat (Absolute Reality)
Causation arises through ritual integrity and conscious participation
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by ontological alignment
Restoration occurs through precise repetition of Vedic ordinances
executable_legal_axioms: IF action involves Havya-Kavya offering THEN adherence to Prathama Kalpa is mandatory
IF actor is established in Sat THEN Anukalpa compliance is binding
IF deviation occurs THEN automatic restoration protocol initiates via Vedic repetition
IF capacity for alignment exists THEN responsibility is fully assumed without punitive attribution
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, intent and ontological establishment supersede procedural form. Where a litigant demonstrates alignment with Sat, their adherence to Anukalpa shall be presumed valid unless gross misalignment is demonstrably manifest through causal disjunction.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that correct performance aligns individual consciousness with cosmic order. Misalignment generates self-corrective feedback, not punitive consequence. Responsibility flows from capacity to sustain alignment, not from error or omission.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Svādhyāya Completion Process to restore ritual memory
Assign Yajña Participation Protocol to realign causal body
Activate Guru-Diksha Reaffirmation Sequence for re-establishing Sat-standing
Deploy Mantra-Shuddhi Correction Cycle to purify performative intention
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: Dharma is restored through alignment with Sat. There is no punishment—only completion. Consciousness is the ultimate judge.
